intro: Elaeocarpus savannarum, commonly known as the African elaeocarp, is a tropical evergreen tree native to regions of Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has glossy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the branches. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests and secondary growth areas. The tree is valued for its hard timber and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
